name: Sorrel Sauce
keywords: baby spinach, heavy cream, sorrel, side dish, spring
recipeIngredient: Coarse sea salt and freshly ground pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the sorrel and spinach and discard the stems. Chop the leaves coarsely. Soften the shallot in the butter in a saucepan. Add the sorrel with the spinach and cook until they have wilted.

Add the chicken stock or water, bring to a boil and simmer for five minutes. Add the cream and puree the mixture in a food processor or blender. If you are using the sauce right away, return it to the saucepan and season to taste with salt and pepper. If you are serving the sauce chilled, refrigerate it for at least two hours.
